intro: Chenopodium berlandieri f. neglectum, commonly known as buffalo bur, is a flowering plant in the Amaranthaceae family. It is native to North America and is characterized by its rough, spiny fruit capsules that resemble small burs. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in prairies, roadsides, and other open areas. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly涩 (astringent) taste. The species is often considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
